qas.question: When did Philharmonie de Paris open?
What are the two largest opera houses in Paris?

answers.text: Opéra Garnier (historical Paris Opéra) and modern Opéra Bastille;

qas.question: What does Opera Garnier specialize in?
In what year were the first performances of Diagheliv's Ballet Russes?
Where di the first performances of Diagheliv's Ballets Russes take place?

context: The largest opera houses of Paris are the 19th-century <a1_0>Opéra Garnier (historical Paris Opéra) and modern Opéra Bastille;<a1_0/> the former tends toward the more <a2_0>classic ballets and operas<a2_0/>, and the latter provides a mixed repertoire of classic and modern. In middle of the 19th century, there were three other active and competing opera houses: the Opéra-Comique (which still exists), Théâtre-Italien, and Théâtre Lyrique (which in modern times changed its profile and name to Théâtre de la Ville). Philharmonie de Paris, the modern symphonic concert hall of Paris, opened in <a0_0>January 2015<a0_0/>. Another musical landmark is the <a4_0>Théâtre des Champs-Élysées<a4_0/>, where the first performances of Diaghilev's Ballets Russes took place in <a3_0>1913<a3_0/>.
